metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3153 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SPIP 2.x before 2.1.19, 3.0.x before 3.0.22, and 3.1.x before 3.1.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code by adding content, related to the filtrer_entites function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-3153` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spip package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.1-1').
